intro: Hebe pimeleoides subsp. faucicola, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hebe, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of violet or blue. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature. Hebe pimeleoides subsp. faucicola is also valued for its role in supporting local wildlife and its use in traditional Māori medicine.
